analyzed: bshos gsol nal na 'ga' yang yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drangs kyi /
translated: But no one has ever invited them to stay for four months with all their needs provided.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drang ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan drang ngo snyam mo //
translated: I will invite the Blessed One and the community of monks to stay for four months with all their needs provided.”

analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //

analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya ming chen la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
translated: When he had sat to one side, the Blessed One, through talk consistent with the Dharma, instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted Mahānāman the Śākya.🔽He perfectly instructed him,🔽perfectly inspired him,

analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug //
translated: Through talk consistent with the Dharma, he perfectly instructed him in many ways,🔽perfectly inspired him,🔽perfectly encouraged him,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: and perfectly delighted him.

original: de nas sh'akya ming chen stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen stan las langs te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di @273b skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas dgung zla bzhir bdag gis na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas dgung zla bzhir bdag gis na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /
translated: “Blessed One, please allow me to provide the Blessed One and the community of monks with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick for four months.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya ming chen la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to Mahānāman the Śākya by remaining silent.

analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang par rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo pos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then Mahānāman the Śākya, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song nas des bsnyung ba'i rung ba'i rung ba'i khang pa rtsig tu bcug cig /
translated: and then departed from the Blessed One’s presence. He had a sick ward built.

translated: He had them store medicinal roots, medicinal stalks, medicinal leaves,🔽medicinal flowers, and medicinal fruits. He had them store medicinal milk, both cow’s milk and buffalo milk, and medicinal curds, both cow’s curds and buffalo curds.

original: ra zhon pa dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / yo byad thams cad dag kyang 'jog tu bcug / sman pa dang bsnyung g-yog dag kyang 'jog tu bcug ste /

analyzed: dge slong dag la yang yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs so //
translated: He provided all the necessary articles to the monks.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“Noble ones, we are not sick.

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bo bca' ba dang / bza' ba 'di lta bu rnyed kyi thabs shig bya'o zhes de dag gis sman pa la dris pa /
translated: “We must find a way to get Nanda and Upananda to eat and consume such food.” They asked the physician,

analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag la nad ci yod pa je ltos shig / sman pas bsams pa /
translated: “Sir, please examine us to see what illness we have.” The physician thought,

analyzed: 'di dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas za 'dod kyi 'di dag dang mthun par smra bar bya'o snyam nas des de dag la smras pa /
translated: “These are shaven-headed śramaṇas. They want to eat. I will speak to them in a way that accords with their wishes.” He said to them,

analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag ni shul gyis dub pa dag lags pas je bskur snum bag gsol la /
translated: “Noble ones, since you are exhausted from traveling, first eat some oily food,

analyzed: de'i 'og tu bska ba dag gsol cig / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: and then eat some astringent food.” They said,

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' 'di ni sman pa chen po nad dang nad kyi gzhi dang khams la mkhas pa rgyal po la mkho ba yin te /
translated: “Nanda and Upananda, this is a great physician who is skilled in illness, the cause of illness, and the humors. He is needed by the king.

original: gal te bdag cag thams cad kyis dus gcig tu de ltar bya bar brtsams na myur du zin par 'gyur @274a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag cag thams cad kyis dus gcig tu de ltar bya bar brtsams na myur du zin par 'gyur @274a * //
translated: If all of us were to begin doing that at the same time, it would be quickly noticed.

original: gyi ; je dang por gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
analyzed: gyi ; je dang por gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o // de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
translated: The first two will attend to the oil massage, and the other four will attend to the illness.🔽After that, the first two will attend to the oil massage, and the other four will attend to the illness.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten cing bzhis nad g-yog bya'o //
translated: After that, the first two will attend to the oil massage, and the other four will attend to the illness.

original: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag las gnyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na ci tsam na zla ba gcig 'das so //🔽de'i 'og tu gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na zla ba gnyis pa 'das so //
analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag las gnyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na ci tsam na zla ba gcig 'das so // de'i 'og tu gzhan gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na zla ba gnyis pa 'das so //
translated: They said, We will do that. The first two began to attend to the oil massage, and the other four attended to the illness. Before long, one month passed.🔽After that, the other two began to attend to the oil massage, and the other four attended to the illness. The second month passed.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis snum bag bsten par brtsams shing bzhis nad g-yog byed pa na zla ba gsum pa 'das so //
translated: After that, the first two began to attend to the oil massage, and the other four attended to the illness. The third month passed.

original: zla ba bzhi pa la thams cad 'dus te bza' bar brtsams nas zla ba bzhi pa 'das pa dang sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs pa dang / nye dgas phyag tshang la phrin spring ste /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi pa la thams cad 'dus te bza' bar brtsams nas zla ba bzhi pa 'das pa dang sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs pa dang / nye dgas phyag tshang la phrin spring ste /
translated: In the fourth month, they all gathered together and began to eat. When the fourth month had passed, Śākya Mahānāman invited the Blessed One to the festival of going forth.🔽Upananda sent a message to the cook:

analyzed: bzhin bzangs deng kho bo la khu sha dang / khu ba dang / sha tshod dag gyis shig ces spring ngo //
translated: “Good man, today prepare for me meat, soup, and meat broth.”

original: phyag tshang gis smras pa /
analyzed: phyag tshang gis smras pa /
translated: The cook said:

analyzed: 'phags pa dgung zla bzhi 'das te sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs ston la spyan drangs na khyed kyi bya ba dung yang ma rdzogs sam /
translated: “Noble one, four months have passed. Śākya Mahānāman has invited the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks to the festival of going forth. Have you not finished your work?”

original: nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa /
translated: Upananda said:

analyzed: bkren pa sh'akya ming chen pos sang rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun zla ba bzhir yo byad thams cad kyis spyan 'dren na /
translated: “Miserly Śākya Mahānāman has invited the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks for four months with all the requisites.

original: gal te spyan drang ba 'di lta bus sang rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni nye dgas kyang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyan 'dren par spro'o //
analyzed: gal te spyan drang ba 'di lta bus sang rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni nye dgas kyang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun ji srid 'tsho'i bar du spyan 'dren par spro'o //
translated: If it is proper to invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks with such an invitation, then I, Upāli, would be happy to invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks for as long as they live.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

analyzed: khyed cag zla ba bzhir sha dang khu ba sha stag zos par gyur kyang 'on kyang khyed cag smod par byed na gnas brtan gang dag gis zla ba bzhir aa ru ra 'bru gcig kyang ma gsol ba de dag ni shin tu dka'ang dbye pa yin no zhes
translated: “You have eaten only meat and soup for four months, and still you are criticizing. Those elders who have not eaten even one myrobalan plum for four months are very difficult to please.”

original: zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang slong bar byed smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar phyed /
analyzed: zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ha cang slong bar byed smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar phyed /
translated: “Why do the monks beg so much?” “Why do they criticize?” “Why do they make fun of us?” “Why do they gossip?”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: de lta @274b bas na dge slong gis ha cang bslang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks should not beg too much.🔽If you beg too much, you will be in conflict with the teaching.

original: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bstabs pa la yang ha cang bslang bar mi bya ba dang / de'i nyes dmigs kyang byung ba'i mtha' sngon grong med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas cig na drang srong zhig 'dug pa la klu gzhon nu zhig rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed cing lus kyis 'khri bas drang srong de la gnod par gyur nas /
analyzed: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bstabs pa la yang ha cang bslang bar mi bya ba dang / de'i nyes dmigs kyang byung ba'i mtha' sngon grong med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas cig na drang srong zhig 'dug pa la klu gzhon nu zhig rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed cing lus kyis 'khri bas drang srong de la gnod par gyur nas /
translated: In a former time, a sage lived in a forest far from a village. A young nāga always served him and wrapped his body around the sage, causing him discomfort.

original: drang srong gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: drang srong gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
translated: Another sage said:

analyzed: khyod klu gzhon du de phyin chad 'ang bar mi 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: “If you do not want that young nāga to come again,

analyzed: gang gi tshe glu gzhon nu de khyod la yo byad thams cad kyis stobs par byed pa de'i tshe na /
translated: when that young nāga offers you all his possessions,🔽you should say, ‘I do not need these.

original: de'i mgo la nor bu 'dug pa de slongs shig dang / klu rnams ni ser sna can yin pas mi ster bas phyin chad 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mgo la nor bu 'dug pa de slongs shig dang / klu rnams ni ser sna can yin pas mi ster bas phyin chad 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You should ask for the jewel on his head. Since nāgas are stingy, they will not give it to you, and you will not come back again.🔽The sage did as he was told. The young nāga asked his parents, but they said, It is not right to give the jewel. He did not come back again, and he remained on the path of invisibility.

original: drang srong des de bzhin byas pa dang klu gzhon nu des pha ma la dris na yang nor bu sbyin du mi rung ngo zhes zer nas phyin chad mi 'ong zhing mi snang ba'i lam la 'dug par gyur pa dang / gzhan yang sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong med pa'i dgon pa zhig na drang srong zhig 'dug pa de'i bsti gnas su bya mang po dag 'du zhing sgra byin te /
analyzed: drang srong des de bzhin byas pa dang klu gzhon nu des pha ma la dris na yang nor bu sbyin du mi rung ngo zhes zer nas phyin chad mi 'ong zhing mi snang ba'i lam la 'dug par gyur pa dang / gzhan yang sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong med pa'i dgon pa zhig na drang srong zhig 'dug pa de'i bsti gnas su bya mang po dag 'du zhing sgra byin te /
translated: Also, in the past, in a wilderness without towns, there was a sage. Many birds gathered and made noise in his hermitage.

analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi tsher ma ni sgra yin pas drangs srong des bya mang po dag gi sgra des sems rtse gcig pa nyid ma thob po //
translated: Since sound is a thorn for meditative concentration, the sage did not attain one-pointedness of mind due to the noise of the many birds.

original: drang srong gzhan zhig gis de la smras pa /
analyzed: drang srong gzhan zhig gis de la smras pa /
translated: Another sage said to him, You should kill the birds.

original: khyod bya de dag phyin chad 'dir 'ong phar mi 'dod na tshes nyi shu dgu'i mtshan mo rtsva'i sgron me spor la shing ljon pa dag gi drung du song ste 'di skad ces sgo bdag bza'o //
analyzed: khyod bya de dag phyin chad 'dir 'ong phar mi 'dod na tshes nyi shu dgu'i mtshan mo rtsva'i sgron me spor la shing ljon pa dag gi drung du song ste 'di skad ces sgo bdag bza'o //
translated: “If you don’t want those birds to come here again, on the night of the twenty-ninth, light a grass torch and go to the foot of the trees. Say, ‘I’ll eat you!’

original: phru gu dag bza'o zhes smros shig dang phyin chad 'ang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phru gu dag bza'o zhes smros shig dang phyin chad 'ang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and ‘I’ll eat your young!’ and they won’t come back again.”

original: des de ltar bya bar brtsams pa dang / bya de dag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: des de ltar bya bar brtsams pa dang / bya de dag gis bsams pa /
translated: He did as he was told, and the birds thought,

original: drang srong 'di smyos par gyur tam snyam nas bya de dag gi phru gu dag 'dab ma skyes par gyur pa dang / de dag dong ste phyin chad mi 'ong zhing ci tsam na mthar gyis de dag thams cad mi snang ba'i lam la 'khod do //
analyzed: drang srong 'di smyos par gyur tam snyam nas bya de dag gi phru gu dag 'dab ma skyes par gyur pa dang / de dag dong ste phyin chad mi 'ong zhing ci tsam na mthar gyis de dag thams cad mi snang ba'i lam la 'khod do //
translated: ‘Has this sage gone mad?’ The young birds grew their wings and flew away. They never came back again, and eventually they all disappeared.

original: dge slong dag re zhig dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags de dag kyang ha cang bslangs pa na mi snang ba'i lam du 'khod na mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dge slong dag re zhig dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags de dag kyang ha cang bslangs pa na mi snang ba'i lam du 'khod na mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Monks, if animals, when harassed too much, disappear, what need is there to speak of humans?”

original: de bas dge slong gis ha cang bslang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas dge slong gis ha cang bslang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks should not beg too much.

original: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes stsal nas /
analyzed: ha cang slong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes stsal nas /
translated: If you beg too much, you will be in conflict with the Dharma.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di @275a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One, for this reason, on this occasion,

analyzed: dang ; skabs 'di la dge slong ge dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / nya dga' la rmas nas dge sbong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: gathered the saṅgha of monks and addressed them:🔽“Monks, you should not beg too much.

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not suitable,🔽it is not proper,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /

analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “How is there an offense in that?”

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, you should understand the characteristics of the offense, the non-offense, the training, and the amendment through the presentation of the actual basis, the preparation, the steps of the preparation, and the non-offenses.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni //
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is defined as follows.

original: dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa pos rang nyid bslab pa de la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong sde snod gsum las mdo sde ma gtogs pa 'dul ba dang / ma mo la sa 'dul ba'i char gtogs pa'i bslab pa la mngon par shes pa nyid kyis smra ba po byis pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa pos rang nyid bslab pa de la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong sde snod gsum las mdo sde ma gtogs pa 'dul ba dang / ma mo la sa 'dul ba'i char gtogs pa'i bslab pa la mngon par shes pa nyid kyis smra ba po byis pa dang /
translated: A fully ordained monk who has committed a downfall should train in the precepts by first asking fully ordained monks who are experts in the three scriptural collections, but who are not childish, ignorant, or unskilled in the precepts belonging to the Vinaya and the mātṛkā, that is, the Vinaya and the Abhidharma.

original: rmongs pa dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pas khyod kyis 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bslab pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa'am bsgo ba na /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pas khyod kyis 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bslab pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa'am bsgo ba na /
translated: He should ask them, “You should train in this precept belonging to the Vinaya,” or “You should train in this precept belonging to the mātṛkā.”

original: bdag dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la @280b 'dri ba'i bar du slob bo zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa'i dge slong 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la mngon pa shes pa nyid dang ldan pa de la byis pa /
analyzed: bdag dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la @280b 'dri ba'i bar du slob bo zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa'i dge slong 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la mngon pa shes pa nyid dang ldan pa de la byis pa /
translated: He should then train by asking fully ordained monks who are experts in the three scriptural collections, who are experts in the Vinaya, and who are experts in the mātṛkā.

original: rmongs pa / mi gsal ba /
analyzed: rmongs pa / mi gsal ba /
translated: unskilled.🔽You do not train in this training by means of your words.”

original: mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig de skad brjod na bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig de skad brjod na bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says such words that proclaim one’s own lack of understanding, one commits the actual basis of a downfall that is a rejection of the setting aside of training.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa pos rang nyid bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po de 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i bslab pa la mngon par shes pa nyid yin par shes pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa pos rang nyid bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po de 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i bslab pa la mngon par shes pa nyid yin par shes pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the one who is causing the downfall knows that the monk who is speaking is a monk who is setting aside training and knows that he is fully aware of the training that is taught in the Vinaya, there is no fault.

original: 'dul ba dang ma mo las gsungs pa 'dul ba'i char gtogs pa'i bslab pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bsgo ba spong ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ma mo las gsungs pa 'dul ba'i char gtogs pa'i bslab pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bsgo ba spong ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the one who is causing the downfall knows that the training that is taught in the Vinaya and the mātṛkā is a training that is part of the Vinaya, there is no fault in rejecting the command to train in it.

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba so sor nges pa'i bslab pa la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa dang / brjod pa 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes mos par byas shing bsgo ba la spong ba la na smad pa med do //🔽bdag dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la 'dri ba'i bar du mi slob po zhes zer ba'i rgyu'i dngos po de dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba so sor nges pa'i bslab pa la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa dang / brjod pa 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes mos par byas shing bsgo ba la spong ba la na smad pa med do // bdag dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la 'dri ba'i bar du mi slob po zhes zer ba'i rgyu'i dngos po de dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: The words, You should train in the precepts that are the individual certainties of the root downfalls, and the words, You should train in these precepts, are the injunctions and the authorization.🔽The words, I will not train in the precepts of the bhikṣus who hold the sūtras, hold the vinaya, and hold the mātṛkā, are the expression of the reason.

original: go bar byed pa'i dge slong dag la byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis mi slob bo zhes zer ba'i mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig de dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i dge slong dag la byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis mi slob bo zhes zer ba'i mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig de dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: The words, I will not train in the precepts of the bhikṣus who make me understand, are the expression of the ignorance.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa smra bo'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa smra bo'o //
translated: The one who does this is the one who speaks of the precepts.

original: dge slong 'dul ba la ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / me gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes la gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba la ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / me gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes la gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The monk who is the speaker, who is a proponent of the training, who is skilled in the training topics, who is not a child, a fool, unclear, or unskilled, who has the perception of the matter, and who is the principal actor.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basis is a downfall through five limbs:

original: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid dang / ltung ba 'byin pa pos de ltar 'du shes pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid dang / ltung ba 'byin pa pos de ltar 'du shes pa nyid dang /
translated: The monk who is the speaker, who is a proponent of the training, who is skilled in the training topics, who is not a child, a fool, unclear, or unskilled, who has the perception of the matter,

original: @281a * // 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod dam /
analyzed: @281a * // 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod dam /
translated: and who says, “You should train in this training topic of the proponents of the vinaya.”

original: bsgo ba nyid dam mi slob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la 'dri ba'i bar du zhes zer ba nyid dang / go bar byed pa la byis pa 'am /🔽rmongs pa 'am /
analyzed: bsgo ba nyid dam mi slob pa'i rgyu'i dngos po dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la 'dri ba'i bar du zhes zer ba nyid dang / go bar byed pa la byis pa 'am / rmongs pa 'am /
translated: The one who instructs is either a child,🔽a fool,

original: mi gsal ba'am /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'am /
translated: or an unskillful person.

original: mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa khyod kyi tshig gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob po zhes mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: The one who is instructed is someone who proclaims his own ignorance by saying, “I do not know this training, because of your words, which are childish, foolish, unclear, and unskillful.”

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the conditions for a downfall are incomplete, then the downfall is not a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins the preparation for a downfall of forsaking the training, but does not complete the preparation, then one commits a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation that one begins for the actual downfall, one commits a minor infraction.

original: mdo sde las gsungs pa'i bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i gnas skabs thams cad la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdo sde las gsungs pa'i bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i gnas skabs thams cad la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action to violate the precepts taught in the sutras in any situation that is a basis for abandoning them.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: A wrong action of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'ang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations of preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: A preparation of preparation is also a wrong action, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa la byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid yin na yang ltung ba 'byin pa pos de ltar 'du shes pa nyid med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i dge slong smra ba po 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par shes pa la byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa ma yin pa nyid yin na yang ltung ba 'byin pa pos de ltar 'du shes pa nyid med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk who is upholding the precepts is a speaker, is knowledgeable in the vinaya, is knowledgeable in the subject of the precepts, and is not a child, a fool, an invalid, or an untrained person, and the one who is causing the downfall does not have the perception that he is doing so.

original: yang dag pa kho nar 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par mi shes pa nyid dang / byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa nyid yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i yul mngon par mi shes pa nyid dang / byis pa dang / rmongs pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa nyid yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not know the subject of training that is taught in the scriptures, and one is a child, a fool, incapacitated, or unskilled.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang ; sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang ; sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, insane, deranged, or overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule on the training that is to be learned is that a monk should train in not relying on any of the forms of training that are grounds for downfall in any situation or place.

original: bslab pa thun mong gi yul thams cad dge slong ma la yang bsgrags par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa thun mong gi yul thams cad dge slong ma la yang bsgrags par bya'o //
translated: The training that is shared with the nuns should be proclaimed to the nuns.

original: dge slong kun shes par 'dod pas kyang bslab pa de la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong kun shes par 'dod pas kyang bslab pa de la bslab par bya'o //
translated: A monk who wishes to understand should train in that training.

original: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la yang dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la yang dri bar bya'o //
translated: You should also ask about them to monks who are holders of the sūtras, holders of the monastic code, and holders of the mother of the victors.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu lnga bshad zin to /
analyzed: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu lnga bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the seventy-fifth downfall: not settling into the training.
